questions.prompt: What is the name for the branch of physics that deals with the transformation of heat into, and from, other forms of energy? The term, first used by Lord Kelvin in the mid-19th c.,  is derived in part from the Greek for "heat."

What is the most common Japanese name for the item the youngster is holding in this photo?
